docs.text: Welcome to Tomato ← Welcome to Tomato Radio Automation! Tomato is easy to use, and hard to screw up playout software written for the specific use case of Burning Man Information Radio . Use Case ← Features ← Why The Name? ← Simply said, this software was named after my cat, Tomato... or more affectionately nicknamed Kitty, Tomatillo, The "Shink", Catly, Catniss Evercat, Mr. Annoying, and Kitty Poopoo. His breed: domestic street urchin. Tomato with his favorite mug. What's Next? ←

docs.text: The Tomato Backend Server ← The backend server is written in Python 's Django web framework , heavily leveraging its automatic admin interface . Installation ← Follow these steps to get started. Installing Docker ← You'll need to install Docker to get started (which now comes preloaded with Compose ). Linux macOS At the command line, execute the following to install Docker, curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com | sh Install Docker Desktop by following the instructions here . Run & Build ← Here are the instructions to install Tomato in both development mode and production mode.
